DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the study was to investigate the effects of different doses of sevoflurane used in electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) on duration of seizure, hemodynamic response and recovery profiles
DOC.detailed_description: Motor (EMG) and electroencephalography seizure duration (EEG), heart rate (HR) and mean arterial pressure (MAP) values, and recovery times were recorded.
DOC.criteria: Study included 25 patients of American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status III aged between 1860 years who were scheduled for ECT sessions under general anesthesia Pregnancy Cerebrovascular disease Epilepsy Unstable cardiovascular disease Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease; and Renal or hepatic failure
